optimize API reference¶

Noise¶

class optimize.noise.CorrelatedNoiseProcess(data=None, kernel=None, name=None)¶

Bases: optimize.noise.NoiseProcess

compute_residuals(pars, linpred)¶

Computes the final residuals (linpred - noise process)

Parameters

  • pars (Parameters) – The parameters to use.

  • linpred (np.ndarray) – The linear predictor.

Returns

The final residuals.

Return type

np.ndarray

initialize(p0, x1=None, xpred=None)¶

Default initializer for correlated noise kernels. By default, only the distance matrix is constructed.

Parameters

  • x1 (np.ndarray, optional) – The x1 vector. Defaults to the Data grid (self.x).

  • xpred (np.ndarray, optional) – The vector to make predictions on. Defaults to x1.

class optimize.noise.GaussianProcess(data=None, kernel=None, name=None)¶

Bases: optimize.noise.CorrelatedNoiseProcess

A noise kernel defined through a single GP and diagonal error terms with an additional “jitter” parameter. Each jitter parameter must be named “jitter_label” where label is the data label.

compute_data_errors(pars, include_corr_error=False, linpred=None)¶

Computes the errors added in quadrature for all datasets corresponding to this kernel.

Parameters

  • pars (Parameters) – The parameters to use.

  • include_gp_error (bool, optional) – Whether or not to include the gp error. Defaults to False.

  • linear_pred (np.ndarray) – The linear predictor; the data vector containing noise.

Returns

The data errors.

Return type

np.ndarray

class optimize.noise.NoiseProcess(data=None, name=None)¶

Bases: object

A base noise process class defined through a covariance matrix. This class is not useful to instantiate on its own.

data¶

The dataset for this noise process.

Type

Dataset

name¶

The name of this noise process. Defaults to None.

Type

str, optional

compute_data_errors(pars)¶

Computes the errors added in quadrature for all datasets corresponding to this kernel.

Parameters

pars (Parameters) – The parameters to use.

Returns

The final data errors.

class optimize.kernels.CorrelatedNoiseKernel(data=None, par_names=None)¶

Bases: optimize.kernels.NoiseKernel

Behaves as a trait for now.

class optimize.kernels.NoiseKernel(data=None, par_names=None)¶

Bases: object

A base noise kernel class defined through a covariance matrix. This class is not useful to instantiate on its own.

data¶

The dataset using this noise kernel.

Type

Dataset

par_names¶

The parameter names for this kernel, optional.

Type

list of strings, optional

initialize(p0)¶

Default wrapper to initialize the kernel, storing the parameters.

class optimize.kernels.QuasiPeriodic(data=None, par_names=None)¶

Bases: optimize.kernels.StationaryNoiseKernel

A Quasiperiodic kernel. The hyperparameters may be called anything, but must be in the order of amplitude, exp length scale, period length scale, and period.

compute_cov_matrix(pars)¶

Computes the QP kernel.

Parameters

pars (Parameters) – The parameters to use.

Returns

The covariance matrix K.

Return type

np.ndarray

class optimize.kernels.StationaryNoiseKernel(data=None, par_names=None)¶

Bases: optimize.kernels.CorrelatedNoiseKernel

Noise kernel which only dependes on the relative difference between 2 values. Also has trait like behavior.

compute_dist_matrix(x1, x2)¶

Computes the stationary distance matrix, D_ij = |x_i - x_j|.

Parameters

  • x1 (np.ndarray) – The first vector.

  • x2 (np.ndarray) – The second vector.

Returns

The stationary distance matrix D_ij

Return type

np.ndarray

initialize(p0, x1=None, xpred=None)¶

Initializes the noise kernel by computing the stationary distance matrix.

Parameters

  • p0 (Parameters) – The parameters to use.

  • x1 (np.ndarray, optional) – The first vector. Defaults to data.x.

  • xpred (np.ndarray, optional) – The vector to make predictions on. Defaults to x1.
